newsitem.title: GERMANY: Clement to succeed Rau in big German state - paper.
newsitem.headline: Clement to succeed Rau in big German state - paper.

text.p: The powerful economics minister of North Rhine-Westphalia, Wolfgang Clement, will succeed Johannes Rau as premier of Germany's most populous state before the next general elections in 1998, a newspaper said on Wednesday.

The Hamburg-based weekly Die Woche said Clement hinted for the first time in an interview it will publish on Thursday that he and Rau had reached an agreement at a meeting of state Social Democratic (SPD) party leaders last week on Rau's departure.

"You are displaying with your question an extraordinary degree of astuteness," Clement said when asked by Die Woche if Clement would replace Rau before the next election. He added that he and Rau had settled the issue in private in May.
North Rhine-Westphalia has been dominated by the SPD for decades.
Rau, who lost the chancellor race to Helmut Kohl in 1986, is considered to be a leading candidate for the SPD in the 1999 presidential election. Rau ran and lost for that office in 1994.
